devis

The goal of devis is to …

Installation

Prerequisities

Linux

sudo apt-get install xdotool #ubuntu
sudo dnf install xdotool     #fedora
sudo pacman -S xdotool       #arch

MacOS

brew install xdotool
defaults write org.x.X11 enable_test_extensions -boolean true  
defaults write org.macosforge.xquartz.X11 enable_test_extensions -bool yes

Package

You can install the development version from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("marcosci/devis")

Example

Mouse movement tracking

If you use RStudio, the most convienent way to track your mouse movement with devis is to use the jobs pane. Just create somewhere a file like the following:

library(devis)

track_mouse("00h00m90s")

visualize_mouse(momove, "tinygrid")

… and specify everything in there that is of interest to you. The time, maybe you don’t want to save the coordinates in a tempfile or you don’t want to immediately plot the data.

Then run the job with the following settings:

Visualize mouse movement

visualize_mouse(mouse_df, type = "dot")

Code of Conduct

Please note that the devis project is released with a Contributor Code of Conduct. By contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms.
